front.title: Light-weight Flow Accounting Protocol Specification Vrsion 5.0

abstract.t: The Lightweight Flow Accounting Protocol (LFAP) is an operationsand management protocol that provides detailed information aboutIPv4 and Ipv6 packets traversing a network element. The primaryfunction of LFAP is the reliable delivery of large volumes ofpacket header derived information from a network element, termedConnection Control Entity (CCE) to a Flow Accounting Server (FAS)of current or historical flows for billing, capacity planningsecurity, or traffic engineering purposes.
